Class TextFileProducer

java.lang.Object
TextFileProducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageProducer
public class TextFileProducer extends Object implements MessageProducer
This class translates a provided file from raw data to usable information and creates a Message[] from it.
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • TextFileProducer

      public TextFileProducer(String filename) throws FileNotFoundException
      Parameters:
      filename -
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - Constructor for TextFileProducer. To instantiate, a filename or source is required. Next, three things are executed before the instance variables are assigned. Firstly, an object of FileInputStream is instantiated. This class obtains input bytes from the provided file or source. Secondly, an object of InputStreamReader is instantiated, which requires a FileInputSteam, so we use the one we just created. This class translates the byte streams into characters based on the chosen charset. In my case, no charset is specified and so the platform's default charset is used. Thirdly, an object of BufferedReader is instantiated. Wraps itself around the reader we just created to simplify the process of reading the characters from the file (actually the characters in the reader-object). The instance variables times, delay and size are assigned to the three first rows in the file used. In this case: 4, 200 and 10. Because the characters are String-objects, they need to be parsed to ints in order to be assigned correctly. An array of Message-objects with the size of times (instance variable) is created. The element of each index is assigned with values from the read file. To do this, Messages[] is iterated with a number of times equal to it's size.

  • Method Details

    • delay

      public int delay()
      Specified by:
      delay in interface MessageProducer
      Returns:
      returns the value of @param delay instance variable of this class. delay is the amount of time each image is shown, measured in ms. The value is read from new.txt in the constructor.

    • times

      public int times()
      Specified by:
      times in interface MessageProducer
      Returns:
      returns the value of @param times instance variable of this class. times is the amount of times the animation is iterated. The value is read from new.txt in the constructor.

    • size

      public int size()
      Specified by:
      size in interface MessageProducer
      Returns:
      0 or messages.length. If messages is equal to null, 0 is returned. Else, messages.length is returned.

    • nextMessage

      public Message nextMessage()
      Specified by:
      nextMessage in interface MessageProducer
      Returns:
      null or messages[currentIndex]. If size() is equal to 0, null is returned. Else, messages[currentIndex] is returned.
